channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Brad Pitt has paid $40 million for a roughly century-old home on a bluff in the Carmel Highlands along California’s central coast https://t.co/ojf2OLmghd
GM's profit fell 40%, hurt by a loss in China and supply-chain troubles that left it with tens of thousands of unfinished vehicles https://t.co/nNCrAxHtzk
Russian gas flows to Germany through the Nord Stream pipeline will drop to about 20% of capacity, Gazprom said, blaming turbine problems https://t.co/4axIshFkis

Russia said it will withdraw from the International Space Station after 2024, a decision that comes after months of tension between the country and its international partners that run the orbiting research facility https://t.co/Xltig4Kpal
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/71a7d7HLLa
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/gNFKEUN8gy
Japan executed a man convicted of killing seven people in 2008 when he rammed a truck into a Tokyo crowd and went on a stabbing spree https://t.co/3HYPrpVWsy
China tried to build a network of informants inside the Federal Reserve system and even detained a Fed economist, according to a report by Senate Republicans https://t.co/jofPYYynfd

A former Goldman Sachs vice president was charged in an insider-trading scheme in which he allegedly profited by tipping off a close friend to confidential information about coming mergers and acquisitions connected to the bank https://t.co/Oy0qHqUIv6
Brad Pitt has paid $40 million for a roughly century-old home on a bluff in the Carmel Highlands along California’s central coast https://t.co/opfrT7TUHK
Walmart cut its profit outlook, warning that higher food and gas prices are causing consumers to pull back. Shares fell 8% after hours. https://t.co/JZjvmIibGp
Most of the nation’s hospitals receive big tax breaks in return for giving people a break on their bills. They’re not very generous. https://t.co/Ca2SItTITT
Russia calls on Ukraine to resume grain shipments, despite its attack on the key port of Odessa over the weekend https://t.co/PuYztpHfDV
Samantha Bee is the latest casualty of the cost-cutting at Warner Bros. Discovery, as the company shuts down her political humor show https://t.co/pubTvsm4bL

New investigations by the SEC and federal prosecutors into hush-money payments made by WWE’s Vince McMahon to settle allegations of sexual misconduct hastened his retirement as chief executive, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/WDijh8uMD4

A former Goldman Sachs vice president was charged in an insider-trading scheme in which he allegedly profited by tipping off a close friend to confidential information about coming mergers and acquisitions connected to the bank https://t.co/Ui2JdwLTWL

The U.S. Department of Energy said it will loan to a General Motors joint venture $2.5 billion to fund construction of three battery cell factories, part of the Biden Administration’s plans to jumpstart the market for electric cars https://t.co/Ni0gMYgwck

Thousands in California were evacuated, critical infrastructure was under threat and power outages were reported as the Oak Fire burned near Yosemite National Park #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/onbrtPcJcd https://t.co/jrhSSk9VzE
Russian gas flows to Germany through the Nord Stream pipeline will drop to about 20% of capacity, Gazprom said, blaming turbine problems https://t.co/uvTw6yLbq5

Disney+ began streaming R-rated movies—“Deadpool,” “Deadpool 2” and “Logan”—for the first time on Friday, as it pushes further into adult-focused content in pursuit of new subscribers https://t.co/zY5vZ048gu

China is leading the world in building new chip factories in a self-sufficiency push that could eventually make some buyers reliant on the country for many of the basic chips now in short supply https://t.co/KMo2JfchKL

Keith Olbermann is launching a daily podcast next month in partnership with iHeartMedia. Making its debut Aug. 1, “Countdown with Keith Olbermann” will be a mix of the outspoken commentator's political and sports takes. https://t.co/m5N2n6NjJ9
Natalie Portman's jacked shoulders and arms in "Thor: Love and Thunder" show this summer’s new beauty standard https://t.co/ZinW7qFt4H
Russia’s military and economic alliances across Central Asia are looking shakier after its invasion of Ukraine. “Are we going to be next?” https://t.co/atZjVk04dH

Myanmar executed four prisoners, including two well-known democracy activists, as the country’s military junta continues its campaign to crush opposition to its rule since seizing power last year https://t.co/a7md7Rc4gm
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/Li0GOAtLU4 https://t.co/UiIDuCFHNr

The message from Russian authorities is simple, according to the lawyer of a physicist arrested for treason: “Wherever you are, whatever condition you may be in, we’ll do with you what we want just to make sure you stay loyal.” https://t.co/cEQo0d3snD
Elon Musk's alleged brief affair with the wife of Google co-founder Sergey Brin led to the couple's divorce filing https://t.co/jCd98FzP6y
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/UIzzxhMpgg
Review: “The Gray Man,” which marks the end of Ryan Gosling's four-year disappearing act, is a big, loud fun. https://t.co/Mv67dF3ELl
Tesla is scheduled for court-ordered settlement talks in a shareholder lawsuit over CEO Elon Musk’s 2018 tweets suggesting he had funding to take the company private https://t.co/lGrB4AOwK2

California’s governor is digging in as businesses warn they are starting to feel the pain of a trucker blockade at the Port of Oakland. “If this carries on, I don’t know what we are going to do.” https://t.co/dSj6BLSPx3

Turkey’s low-cost drones helped alter the balance of power in Ukraine’s battle against the Russian invasion, as a two-decade-long project to become a weapons-manufacturing powerhouse is starting to pay off https://t.co/1hOboR0Tii

China is leading the world in building new chip factories, a step toward achieving more self-sufficiency in semiconductors that could eventually make some buyers reliant on China for many of the basic chips now in short supply https://t.co/0fkDenn6if
The U.S. often spends more on infrastructure than other nations for similar projects, yet ends up with disappointing results. Is there a way to do better? https://t.co/A7fnIEM65D
Saudi Arabia plans to construct two parallel buildings up to 1,600 feet tall and stretching for 75 miles across mountains and desert https://t.co/sPj7xxrzPR

Rep. Liz Cheney, the Jan. 6 panel’s vice chair, said on CNN that the committee has a number of new interviews lined up next, including with additional members of former President Trump’s cabinet and his campaign https://t.co/4OMqbNAFOX
Elon Musk's alleged brief affair with the wife of Google co-founder Sergey Brin led to the couple's divorce filing https://t.co/8j1YfITQsS

The Chinese military has become significantly more aggressive and dangerous over the past five years, the top U.S. military officer said during a trip to the Indo-Pacific Sunday https://t.co/f9FiQaFue8
Pope Francis left on what he has called a penitential pilgrimage to Canada, where he will seek to atone for the historical abuse of indigenous children at church-run schools https://t.co/YxbsCOB3ya
Pope Francis left on what he has called a penitential pilgrimage to Canada, where he will seek to atone for the historical abuse of indigenous children at church-run schools https://t.co/yfzXikvLAG

From @WSJopinion: The GOP still has the ability to restore its reputation on spending, but it needed to start yesterday, writes @KimStrassel. A good first step would be saying no to any form of Chuck Schumer’s corporate-welfare blowout. https://t.co/IsKlnlcrqe
Russia’s military and economic alliances across Central Asia are looking shakier after its invasion of Ukraine. “Are we going to be next?” https://t.co/QySGy8VdeT
Tesla is bidding for public dollars to build electric-vehicle chargers, a move that would start to open some of its network to non-Tesla drivers https://t.co/eqDlJc5ATC
Monkeypox is now a global health emergency, the WHO said. There are more than 16,000 cases across dozens of countries. https://t.co/Q1o2mFnlGp
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/aBJf3d30Iy

Washington risks relying excessively on the Fed to lower inflation by reducing demand, rather than have other policy makers work to increase the economy’s capacity to supply more goods and services or workers https://t.co/wVAxlmGZ6x
President Biden’s symptoms are improving three days after he tested positive for Covid-19, one of his advisers and his doctor said Sunday https://t.co/t0VUH3im7L
Toronto’s Pearson International has won top honors for airport service for years, but now it's at the epicenter of a global air-travel meltdown https://t.co/uDv3FlDlIl
Elon Musk's alleged brief affair with the wife of Google co-founder Sergey Brin led to the couple's divorce filing https://t.co/ne5vsdnEVf
